cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts and processes specifically concerned with urban legends as a form of modern folklore, including their nature and how they spread and proliferate in society.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Urban legends as modern folklore and their spread and proliferation across regions and media.

members.entity_description: A category of modern folklore stories, such as the Hook Man, that circulate widely within communities through oral and digital transmission.
Dissemination of urban legends across regions and continents.
The widespread increase and spread of urban legends in society and media.

cluster_classes.class_description: Narrative stories within modern folklore, typically contemporary, that spread socially through communities and media, blend fact and fiction, and frequently reflect societal fears and anxieties.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: modern folklore explicitly includes urban legends as part of contemporary traditional stories and beliefs

members.entity_description: Narrative stories within modern folklore, often fictional, that spread socially through communities and communication technologies, blending fact and fiction and frequently reflecting societal fears and anxieties.

args.new_description: Urban legends as a form of modern folklore: contemporary narrative stories that blend fact and fiction, reflect social fears and anxieties, and their dissemination and proliferation through communities and media.
args.justification: Both classes have the same label 'Urban Legends', nearly identical descriptions that define urban legends as modern folklore narratives, and overlapping concept/process entities about urban legends and their spread, so they represent the same underlying concept and should be unified.
The merged class clearly belongs under a single broader grouping that covers urban legends as part of modern folklore, so harmonizing the class_group to a unified label improves schema consistency.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes have the same label 'Urban Legends', nearly identical descriptions that define urban legends as modern folklore narratives, and overlapping concept/process entities about urban legends and their spread, so they represent the same underlying concept and should be unified.
The merged class clearly belongs under a single broader grouping that covers urban legends as part of modern folklore, so harmonizing the class_group to a unified label improves schema consistency.
